A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being 
clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally 
graphic.
B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima 
calling for her mother.

Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only 
spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband 
for 3 months.

Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted 
to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of 
my friends.

My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months 
in hospital.
Talking with someone I admire a lot.

Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money 
stolen.
Caused a family disturbance.
I was \best man\" at my brother's wedding a year ago."

Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told 
the group around us of advances I had made.
Hearing my girlfriend accept my offer of marriage.

Brother continually interupting while I was talking on the 
telephone.
Hearing of the death of a friend who had been skiing.
When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.
When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.

A person I really like left for overseas for a few months, I had 
hoped to go out with her soon.

When I received my U.E. accredited as I was totally unexpecting 
it and I was so happy.

When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a major 
operation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not a 
relative she had no relatives in N.Z.
I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.

I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, they 
lost the text-book and gave me no compensation.

At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sad 
as I had to leave many friends and family members behind.

Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from 
boarding school on accrediting leave.

When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgements 
on him.

At my grandfather's funeral - My grandparents virtually raised me 
as my mother was a solo-parent and had to work.
The birth of my first child.

Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Union 
announced that the All Blacks' would accept the invitation of 
South Africa to play rugby in that country.

When I was told a friend's baby had been born with only partial 
sight. This was her first child and she was not young (the mother 
that is).

I was biking with my boyfriend, the sun shining after a long 
period of bad beather, afterwards we spent the evening and night 
together.

In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the 
opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions 
as negative. We however only posed several questions which she 
couldn't answer.

When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age 
of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the 
funeral: I sat on the table and cried.
When passing the final examinations for social worker.

A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a while 
the chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair, 
he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.
When the relationship with my girlfriend broke up.

A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on 
holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go 
on holiday.

The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used 
to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that 
made me angry.

It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a 
boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons. 
Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.

At the moment when I heard the result of an examination and it 
proved that I succeeded the second year of my study.

When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to 
listen to me.
My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.

I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I 
have done things good in relation to other people especially when 
my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.

A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our 
relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was 
very angry about that.
I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.
When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.

When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother 
in confindence.

Tonight in bed when I realised how bad my relationship with my 
friend was.

When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very 
good and we were very satisfied.

I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after two 
afternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.

Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this 
I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful 
moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.

At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and 
by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.

I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other 
person didn't appear.

When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arranged 
to go out together.
When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.

When the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the final 
of the Europe Cup at Athens.
At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.
[ The same as in guilt.]
The day I finished my military service.
One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.
The day I left my first girlfriend.
When I won the first prize in a cross country race.

An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to 
spend spare time were disapproved.
I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.
When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.

When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in the 
U.E.F.A cup.

When my dog died.  I had reared it for nearly three years.  It 
had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.  One 
morning I found it dead.

When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people 
and close friends.

When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me 
she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the 
study for speech therapy.

We lived with 3 persons in the loft of a house. It often occurred 
that other persons again and again climbed the stairs with much 
noise. When I was studying I couldn't concentrate and got angry.

It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during 
an examination of personality while I thought I performed very 
badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.

My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them 
in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I 
couldn't play them again.

When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours 
were terrible.

Unofficially I was informed about my results of the final 
examination of the secondary school. A teacher wrote them up for 
me. When I went outside, I started crying with joy.

If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my 
parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.

I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences, 
after having spend two weeks there with my friends.

When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our 
holiday together.

Someone who always took care for the key of the sportshall stayed 
away without letting us know. Next time he did as if nothing had 
happened.
When my last relation broke up.
When I passed the driving test (on the second try).

I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for 
them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of 
them cut up some material I flared up.

My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now 
her brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walk 
and she can hardly talk.

When I started a relation with a girl, with whom I have fallen in 
love already some time ago.

I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to 
thoughtlessness of some colleagues.

My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and 
suffered an aphasia.

I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to 
move up to the second year course.

I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girls 
kept talking about boys, chatting up etc. I bacame sick of it.

I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our 
relationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we shared 
everything and all this was finished.

I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That 
appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long 
time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the 
departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.

I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I became 
awake because a friend called me for some (in my opinion) 
nonsens reason.

My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in 
love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied 
that he loved that girl more than he loved me.

When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, 
I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail, 
but it appeard that we both had passed.

I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any 
longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very 
much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.
Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).

A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said very 
unreasonable things about me, that hit me strongly.

The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness 
was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also 
experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).

When a friend of mine had her period, while thinking she was 
pregnant.
When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.
When a friend died.

Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of 
Nijmegen) for a while.

When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should 
do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. 
Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.

When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel 
for one year.

A fellow player, quite unexpectedly, scores a goal, which means a 
draw.

While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who 
frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In 
my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

I was together with my family one night, a few days after my 
father had died, during that conversation I expressed my 
displeasure because nobody understands me.

When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after a 
period in which he felt very depressive.
When, late at night, I discovered that they had stolen my bike.

When a friend, after being free of drugs for half a year, started 
using them again.

When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee 
and I refuse to give him this.

Watching a football game. This remindes me of the time when my 
father was still alive and when we watched football games on TV 
together.
When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.

My father promised me a bicycle for my birthday. Just before my 
birthday he forgot he promised this to me.
A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).
I had a very pleasant conversation with one of my friends.
My bicycle was demolished.

During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and 
other family members crying.

This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact 
a few years ago.

Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only 
thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking 
only about himself.

My girlfriend does practice and therefore leaves me alone at 
night and in the weekend. In addition, she is very busy doing 
several things. So we don't see each other often.

My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the 
hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic 
Hospital, then he died.

I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that 
didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.

My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the final 
examination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade they 
said nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have become 
very angry.

When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing 
our relationship.

A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than 
me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her 
own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).

When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, 
which my father also adheres.

I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no 
work, only loneliness.

When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although 
I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.

When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raised 
criticisms all the time.

When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill and 
probably would die. We had not expected this because he 
was always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn, 
gave him medicines during the night.
Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.

I suffer from a disease of my muscles. Therefore, I am only able 
to attend lectures for half a day. So, sometimes I miss 
obligatory lectures. However, the teachers do not take into 
account my disease, and punish me with detention work, resulting in 
an overload.

I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk 
about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They 
try to repress it.

When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while I  was 
buying bathing soap.
When I failed the grade seven examination.
The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried 
to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my 
sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.  
There was a fight.

When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my 
mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who 
is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the 
hospital.
\Boy
When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.

My elder brother had been expelled from college and he was so 
frustated that he attempted suicide - he drank bottle fragments.  
I was very sad when I learnt this.

I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kind 
at school and I was only in form II then.

My younger brother destroyed and gave away some of the books that 
I had intended to keep for as long as possible.

When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time 
that someone so close to me had died.

My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and received 
the presents.

When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on 
account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at 
secondary school.

When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away after 
having had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.
My fiancT left me for my best friend.
A recurrent lovesickness.

Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am 
to free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays the 
night.
The dying of a close member of the family.
When I passed a very important exam.

A friend came to visit me late one night. He promised to stay 
only a quarter of an hour, but he stayed 5 hours !! He didn't 
leave and I was very angry.

I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I 
was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish 
that training.
I went to visit friends and it was very companionable.

During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This 
led to friction in a lot of situations.

Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while 
I thought she was in love with me.

Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening 
around me which pleases me.

When a teacher tells a story which isn't true. It only reflects 
his way of interpreting reality.

I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the 
subject in this manner I will not attain this.

My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where they 
adopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.

I work at a petrol station. When there is a foreigner who wants 
petrol my collegues treat him very impolite.

An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his 
life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.
When I got my drivers licence.
The stories about the way my grandmother treated my mother.
When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.

Every year during carnival I am very joyful I have an intense 
feeling of happiness then.

I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace 
when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves 
that I have fallen in love with him.

Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in 
love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with 
another boyfriend.

When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And 
most important she also liked me.

After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner that 
evening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.
When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.

When an old schoolfriend phoned me to arrange an appointment to 
talk about old memories. I hadn't seen him for 8 years.

My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in 
my relationship with my girlfriend.

My girlfriend left the house in which we lived together a few 
months ago. This made me very sad.

Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many 
friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I 
could have embraced everybody.
Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.

I fell over head and ears in love with someone who appeared to be 
in love with me. it made me so happy that I could hardly sleep 
and eat for one week.

I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that 
he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should 
watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through 
the room.

My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying 
psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet 
frequently anymore.
I was called and invited to have a talk about a job I wanted to have.

There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives 
in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I 
accused him of several things.

The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt 
the other person very much.
When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.

When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person. 
His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.
When the mother of a good friend of mine died.

After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one 
year in a foreign country.

I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into the 
wrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me very 
denigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.

A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense 
feeling of sadness.

When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to 
our favorite dancing.
A friend started to shout at me. He called me an old frump.

My relationship with a boyfriend was finished and I didn't 
succeed a years-course.

When I made the winning goal during a very important football 
game.

Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called 
\treatment\" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II."

The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the 
moment of dying I was with her.

When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeks 
overtime.
Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.

I had this feeling when my parents distroyed a relationship with 
a boy because they thought he was bad and irresponsible.
A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.

I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the Free 
University in Driebergen.

I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend 
told me that she would go to travel next year with another good 
friend. We couldn't talk this out.

I was very sad when I had to leave persons with whom I had a very 
intense relationship I also had to leave the environment which 
was part of this.

When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequently 
went to his family. We had a very nice evening.

When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeeping 
while my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a period 
of exams when I had to study very hard.

When my best friend got a boyfriend. Because of this a 
relationship of ten years was finished abruptely.
The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.

We had to move to a very different city because the company where 
my father worked also moved to that place. It was very difficult 
for me to make new friends than.

A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I 
didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.

When Christmas holiday started, I felt very joyful when I 
finished my last exam.

I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as much 
money as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brother 
was better off then me.

When my gradmother died.  I felt very sad then ... The feeling 
started to be worse after a while.

My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her 
and telling nice things to her.

My boyfriend told me that I had very high demands towards him. In 
my opinion this was wrong.

I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to 
visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was 
very different from what I expected.

During my high school time I succeeded to play a concert of 
Mozart on the piano when I gave my first performance I succeeded 
to play it very well.

When our cat was killed in a car-accident I was very angry at the 
driver of the car because he didn't take enough care.

There is a boy who I love very much. I asked him to have dinner 
with me, but he refused I don't know why he didn't go with me, 
but I felt very lonely.

When I saw a good friend again after not having seen her for a 
long time.

When people without my permission pry in my belongings and take 
things out of it.

When I noticed that my parents were not in such a prosperity as 
most people in my surroundings.

When I went to visit a friend in the hospital. She had to undergo 
an operation for rupture. I was glad to hear that the operation 
succeeded and that she was relieved of her pain.

I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment. 
She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. She 
expected me to explain it to her.

I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't 
pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was 
very sad because it became a real quarrel.

When I got the positive result of my examination to achieve the 
Bachelor Degree in Plychology.

My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pm 
however she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we had 
to go out that evening).
When my girlfriend decided to finish our relation.
When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.

When a discussion resulted in an insult, which in my opinion, was 
not justified.

When I realized that it did not make much sense to start a 
relationship with a girl who was not very constructive to 
establish a firm relationship.
On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.

My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that my 
mother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn't 
tell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.

I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I 
realised that I could feel very jealous of other women because 
of my boyfriend.

I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at 
first he had said that he would not do that.

When someone does not listen to me after having asked me to 
repeat what I said. This happened more than one time with the 
same person.
I felt very sad when I heard that a friend had committed suicide.

For a few days I felt very miserable, distressed and listless, 
with crying fits. When this was over I felt very happy, although 
there was no special reason.

Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritated 
because at night the music didn't stop in time. And at breakfast 
my boyfriend ran away because we didn't agree with him. I felt 
angry.

Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a few 
days. There was nothing I liked in that period.

When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have 
made a nice walk together.

Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night. 
Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day 
before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to 
church with his parents.

We had to take our cat to the vet for mercy killing (an 
injection).

One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then 
realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to 
have them as friends.

When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and 
bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and 
didn't want to talk to me any more.

When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship made 
clear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choose 
his girlfriend (also a friend of mine).

My boyfriend suffered form ill health for some months, this week 
the physician told him that he was restored to health.

I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter. 
However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too 
late.

My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years. 
His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That 
feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good 
grade for an examination.

When, after having cleaned up the kitchen, two hours later I saw 
that there was a big mess. It irritated me very much.

One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend 
died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the 
funeral I felt very sad.

When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me 
too.

When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class 
during a turn.

My mother unjustly became very angry with me and sent me to my 
room while my father explained that the way she saw things was 
not correct. I had done things with the best intentions.

Once a week I work as a volunteer in a biologic garden. this work 
in the garden and the contact with other volunteers filled me 
with joy. They also gave me support after I failed passing my 
driver's test.

When someone made me a compliment after an examination just at 
the moment I needed it. It was amicable, hearty and sincere.

A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar 
terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no 
reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I 
would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).

I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason, 
they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and 
unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could 
manage things.

A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend. 
Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was 
shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long 
time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full 
speed.

I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go out 
together. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren't 
there. I became very angry because I thought they were gone 
without me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.

I finished the relationship with my boyfriend, after having felt 
myself very unhappy for a long time.

A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything 
turned out fine.

A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along 
with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I 
had to face the situation.
When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.
When they told me that I had got a study grant.
When my father was saved from a severe work accident.
When I first saw a person begging.
When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.

When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance 
exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.

We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were 
dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to 
urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the 
military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine 
of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too 
late for anyone to give us a lift.

I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I 
was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were 
some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less 
good time.

The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia on 
holiday.
At home when they lost three pieces of my puzzle.
When I had an argument with a friend.

A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to 
the university.

My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the 
conditions they imposed on me.

A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her 
back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled 
the wrong number.
When my brother was born.
Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.
The death of a friend.

When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It 
made me forget all my problems.

When I was told that a boy did not want to be my friend without 
any apparent reason.

When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three 
years.

When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for 
her all night, not knowing where she was.

I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules 
she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.

When I learned that a friend of mine had not been speaking to her 
boyfriend for a week after an argument because of unfounded 
jealousy.

After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was 
very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.

I felt angry when I saw on T.V the last slaughter of negroes in 
South Africa.
When I saw the pictures of the draught in Etiopia.

The day the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the 
final at Athens.

During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants 
made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.

When I heard the last regulation of the socialist govrenment 
concerning pensions.
When I passed an important exam.

When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thus 
including me in the \family war\"."
When my parents got divorced.
When I passed an exam which I had failed last year.
A murder.
When I failed two subjects last year.

When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip 
with my friends.

During an argument between friends, one of them accused me of 
taking advantage of some other friends who usually come to the 
university in my car, saying that I ask them too much money for 
the petrol.
When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.

When I saw that I had passed an exam.  It was the last chance and 
there was a lot at stake.

My cousins were playing at home and one of them broke a decorative 
object which was very precious to me.

All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did 
not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number 
but I do not think that this was true.

When I pass exams, or when a close friend of mine recovered 
from an illness,etc.

During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a 
student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to 
assume my financial situation.
[ Depressions.]

When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of 
separation.

An argument among several friends because of the irrational 
behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and 
said that we were to blame.

A class-mate died after being two months in coma, after a car 
accident.
When my sister was born.
When I failed an exam unfairly.
When my grandmother died.
When my little sister was born.

When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious of 
a composition written by a class-mate and me.
The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.
When I passed an exam.
When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.
When my dog died.

I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.   
When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.
When I saw my brother being attacked and I could not do anything.
When a class-mate died.

I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's 
difficulty.

When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration, 
simply because the child had been leaning against a window.

A friend of mine who was driving a car ahead of me died in a 
car accident.

When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good 
one.

When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to 
stay up all night for the fair in my town.

When summer is over and I have to leave the town where I spend my 
holidays.

When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a 
baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part 
very well but did not know the second part.
When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expenses 
paid.

When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively 
with referance to sex.

I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him 
and and my Easter holidays.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for 
an exam inside it and they got all mixed up.
When my mother was operated.

My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all 
very worried but it was successful.

An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by 
a group of louts.

A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place 
which was 1 metre high.

I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she 
had obtained a grant to work in the library.

I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who help 
each other in exams, to the professor.

I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with 
either of them, so I had to change my plans.
The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.
A typical family argument.
The disqualification of two of my mates in the military service.
When I pass an exam.

When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers 
wandering around, doing nothing.
When someone in my family died.

I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to 
study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had 
passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in 
my hometown.

I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me.  
Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem a 
lot.

When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was 
about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.

I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. 
 I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we 
went there because we knew we would meet there.

I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at 
the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control 
myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger 
on her as she did not obey me.

My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing 
heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it 
deep into her hand.

A friend of mine suggested that I become a film extra.  The idea 
seemed very funny to me and my reaction seemed rather outlandish 
to the others.

When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an 
hour for the next one.
When I knew I had to go out with my mother on some errands.

When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go 
there, if I wished, in Summer.

In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I 
played very badly.

When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit 
suicide.

When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I 
had taken this test.

I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my 
ability or my knowledge of the subject.
When I passed the university entrance exam.
When my brother was held up and robbed.
When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.

I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long 
time.

A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to 
justify a wrong action.

I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to 
cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a 
long time.

At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not 
seen for some time

When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking 
out of the glass.

I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have 
been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went 
to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great 
the distance between us was.

Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that 
she loves me.

We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were 
watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering 
me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  
by hitting one of them.

[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back 
home, I felt very sad.]
A party I went to last Christmas.
During my last exam.
When I had to come back from my village last Christmas.
When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.

On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in 
which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high 
responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.

Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundings 
and into a situation of loneliness.

When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were 
made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to 
do this.

When the train taking me to my military service left the station, 
on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I 
had a hard year ahead.

I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very 
funny.

In a confrontation with a person, he provoked me several times 
till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no 
disastrous consequences.
I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.

When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making a 
journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.

When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I 
was right and she was not.

When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I 
had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.

When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till    
the tour began.

When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one 
university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon 
authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.

We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and 
said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints 
and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.

When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining 
low marks, but they were much higher than expected.

My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and 
my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and 
ridiculous point of view made us angry.
I had failed some subjects in mathematics.

When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned 
my love.

When I was the target of a great many insults and completely 
unfair accusations of a large group of people.
When my best friend died, at the age of 16.

When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very 
long time.
When I was accused of something I had not done.
A close friend died.

I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short 
time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt 
very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, I 
felt hurt and disgusted.

A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me no 
attention.  She keeps up appearances but shows almost no interest 
in me.

When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I 
needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.

My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and 
saw the scene and became angry.
I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.
When I talk to my friends.
When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.
When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.

[ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, in 
class, in the street, at home, at the table..........]

When I learned that several people had died in the street due to  
the cold weather.

When I saw in the newspapers, on the T.V, and magazines the 
chaotic situation caused by the drought and hunger in 
Mauritania.

One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I 
most wished, around me.

When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he 
had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should 
not have been punished for it.

A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was 
not the same as before and something had gone wrong.

When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of 
medicine.
[ No description.]

When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked 
quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.
When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.

I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I 
wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.
At my grandfather's death.

When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film 
marathon I wanted to see.

I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams 
would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to 
obtain some more information and they told me that the exams had 
already taken place.

I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid, 
telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged 
everythiing for them.
The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.

My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied 
up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had 
done nothing.

At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he 
liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had 
attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time 
and I had lost his address and telephone number.
When I saw a car run over a child, out of carelessness.

I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a 
lot for it.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting 
for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  
woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I 
was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found 
him.
My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.
I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.

I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had 
not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me 
and he lost it.
To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.

My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some 
problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  
was all right.

I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told 
it to some others who were implicated in the affair.

The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back 
to University and to the exams.

Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had 
previously failed.

My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite 
my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.

When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did 
not know what would happen.

One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There 
was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.

[ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In 
addition I was asked many questions which I did not want to 
answer.]

I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not 
have the money to do it.

It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could 
at last be with the people I wanted to see.

When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a 
certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see 
that nobody cared about what was happening to me.

I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in 
Madrid.

My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me 
telling me how she had got drunk the last time.
[ No response.]

Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a 
long time.

My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was 
my sister who had done it.
[ No response.]

When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been 
very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers 
from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which 
I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more 
money to carry on studying.

The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after 
several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each 
other.

When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished 
with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one 
which I had desired a lot.

When my father made my mother go through really terrible 
situations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........

When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty, 
lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.
On my birthday, when I was given my presents.

When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the 
wardrobe.  My brother had done it.

When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had 
failed.

The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get 
there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there, 
everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a 
wonderful time all day long.

A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the 
telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry 
and made the other person apologize.

A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another 
girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years 
and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not 
believe it.
On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.

They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that 
the one I had was out of date.
When I came back from my holidays.

When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a 
fortnight.

When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and 
she was fed up with my behaviour.

When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated 
from them for about three months.

I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in 
an exam.  She told me that I had passed.

My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.  
She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things 
as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that 
some of my relatives had died in an accident.

I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not 
expected this so I was very happy.

I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something 
that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to 
tease me.
When my grandfather died.

When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the 
examinations she was about to take.

One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted 
a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.
When I was told that my uncle had passed away.

When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       
a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent 
way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about 
something.

When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by 
thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

After going through much shame, I became a Christian and 
something new happened in my heart.  Joy that overflows was 
manifest in me.

When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him 
\Mister\".  I refused to succumb

When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of 
a sore on the leg.
When I first passed a job interview.

When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while 
I was at school.  Actually I had not been allocated any work.

A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having 
failed the exams.
When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made 
me wonder if he was a really a good friend.
When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.

When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my 
standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was 
somebody else's wife and niece at the same time.  I was very 
angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after 
having been punished for it.

1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's 
reaction to the students demands concerning the educational 
system.

When I was accepted for further education, here at the 
university.

When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha 
note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money 
was found later.

When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and 
was in hospital.
When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.

When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him that 
I had told them that I was pregnant.  My daddy  told my mother 
and she asked me if it was true.  I was very angry with my aunts.
When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.
When I had my four children.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.
When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.

This happened when I went to check my first year results, I had  
thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass in 
all my courses.
When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.

I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after 
we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's 
problems.
When I was told that I had passed the exams.
When my sister broke my china tea set.
I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.
When I learnt that I was selected for form I.

When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and 
looking down on me.

When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it 
to UNZA.
When I passed the grade 7 exam.

When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in 
it and threw it in the dust-bin.

This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was 
planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.
The time I qualified to enter secondary school.

When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently 
gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed 
over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a 
witness.

The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had 
been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my 
wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.

I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a 
Christian.

When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume      
my studies in time at UNZA.
When I heard that my nephew had passed away.

When my uncle gave me my first year's results.  I opened the 
envelope and my eyes ran into two \B+\" - in EC110 and M160

When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining 
engineering, after having prayed one week in the church I was 
not even selected.

This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal 
and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was 
contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her 
response.

This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my 
trousers without my consent.

When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 
and we were about to take the main exam.

I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition. 
 In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored  
the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell 
down.

The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called  
the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.  
I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining 
school to cool off.

A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm.  All his 
things had been taken, His dad had died a little before this 
event.  He gathhered his children and vowed to give them a good 
life with a new start - the words were hollow, he bit back his 
tears .....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the 
loo.

I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my 
school congratulating me for my performance at the previous 
year's exam.

When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my 
certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew 
nothing about this.

My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the 
information that she had died.
My being admitted to UNZA.

I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my 
father, however he misused the money.
The loss of my mother.
My first kiss.
My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.
When a friend left me and went back home for good.
When I passed my form three exams.

When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking 
behind my back.
When I heard about the death of my aunt.

One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my 
friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we 
stayed indoors.

When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a 
very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.
When someone chased me from his house.

When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a 
student like me.

I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning 
the plates and there was no food for me, and the blue birds  
(security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to 
be for me.

That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my 
brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and 
two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital 
 to see my brother.
When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.
When my uncle died.

I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first 
year examination and was among the thirty students who would 
major in economics.

I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were 
not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I  
had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.

It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my 
sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so 
that I could take my exams.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with 
our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made 
me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.
When my beloved grandfather died.

I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the 
second year.

This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my 
friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She 
was the last of my grand parents to pass away.
When my first child was born.

When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of 
nine only.

When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone 
an operation.
I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.
I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.

I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knocked 
down by a car.

When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the 
teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.

When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was 
occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time 
student at UNZA.

When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away 
instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to 
wait at his home so that I could see his new car.
When I received my promotion letter.

I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular 
job was not done, it was not my job to do it.

My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the  
family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not 
gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been 
different.

When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former 
secondary school.
When I was mistreated by my step-mother.
When my aunt passed away in early 1982.

When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well 
in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.

When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her 
boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole 
thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He 
embarassed me in front of a crowd.

When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had 
 seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been 
waiting to see us.

After a long time (of no communication with him, physical 
illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected 
to see him.

The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and 
make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the 
prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.

My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and 
cousins.  She said that I was very lazy and I felt so sad that I 
cried myself to sleep.

My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         
primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  
Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would 
find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's 
room.

I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known 
that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this 
message he was already dead.
When my father bought me a suit.

I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding 
party.
I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that 
my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.
When my father passed away.
When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

When I found out that my sister had been playing with my 
confidential things which she had taken from my hand-bag.

When one of my best friends commited siucide during these 
holidays.

When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due 
at 1400 hours.

When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a 
car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.

The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for 
a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be 
selected.

When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with 
certain other friends which they thought was improper.
The day my teacher of Latin and French died.

I was very happy when I received the year end results as I was 
worried about how well I had done.  I was very happy to know that I 
had passed.

I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to 
remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was 
that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askad 
me to tell her about it.  I was very angry with my friend as I 
had trusted her.

I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every 
time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my 
registration at UNZA.

I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interested 
me, by my employers.
When I learnt of the death of a friend.
When I first came to the campus.

When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards 
another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly 
knocked him out.
When I lost my father in a car accident.

When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had 
not expected to do so well.

When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus 
holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt 
angry over his actions.

When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from 
what I was told about it.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  
A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see 
him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.

When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a 
murder).
Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  
When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my 
inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.
When my grandfather died.

I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  
I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to 
marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not 
leave her alone.

When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to 
rest.
When I won some coins in a small competion.

My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very 
naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.

This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was 
attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate 
woke me up.
When I was selected for the university.

When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my 
wardrobe.
When my grandmother passed away.

When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a 
long time.

When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not 
know.

The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the 
Zambia closed badminton championships.
When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.

When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given 
me.

When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation 
and they are together now).

When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever 
cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to 
learn that it was me who was delaying things.
When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead 
mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her 
abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our 
suprise she had a baby 2 months back.

I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she 
went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It 
was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who 
had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we 
went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I 
was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my 
friend.  That day I was really sad.

I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA 
was approved after it had been cancelled.
When someone took my pen away.

When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell 
ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.
When I was with someone I love.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
When my dad passed away.
At my sister's wedding.
When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.

When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of 
Zambia.

When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my 
lover and future wife.
When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my 
grade six.

I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last 
born in the family.

I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the 
transport money I had to go to school.

I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and 
she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.
When I was selected to study here at UNZA.
When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
When I heard of the death of my mother.

I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter 
to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year 
courses.

In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating 
up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible 
for his guardian's failure.

Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had 
passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the         
biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.

When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who 
qualified for form I that year.

When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been 
disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  
days earlier.

When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the 
death of my father.
When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.
When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
When my elder brother died.
When my brother gave me a watch.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.
When the girl I loved turned me down.

When I passed the first year and so I could come back for my 
second year.

One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had 
objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced 
me to come.  The day of the appointment I had to wait for him 
for over an hour.

When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as 
she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard 
to accept.

I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying 
colours and that I had made it to the university.

One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I 
was sure that I had done no such thing.
The passing away of my mum.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.
When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.

When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a 
car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my 
form five exams with flying colours.

When my sister's first child came home, after one week in 
intensive care at the hospital.

A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical 
school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been 
left out.  Biased judgment !

My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then 
the older one died a week later.
When I met my mother after not having seen her for three years.

When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in the 
presence of my boyfriend.

My father resigned from work, and soon after this his elder brother 
died.  The next day my granny died (my mother's mother).  My dad 
remains the only living member of his family.

For my parents anniversary, we hosted a party and we were very 
happy.

Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not 
really true.
A break-up with someone I really liked.
When I accepted Jesus Christ as my personal saviour.

When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my 
parents.
When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.
When I attended my cousin's 31st birthday.
When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.

When I received my results and found out that I could not go to a 
school of my choice.
When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).

When I discovered that my girlfriend was going around with 
another boy.
When my grandfather died.

When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male 
creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart 
for all her life.

When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he 
had just repaired.

When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and 
that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange 
for the ones I had given her.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.

When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine 
as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part 
with a few coins for their drinks.

When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I 
depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of 
their daughter's buisness.

When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just 
come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe 
which I opened and was overcome with joy.

A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was 
not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.  
I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the          
West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.

When I was selected to this university despite my having 
studyied in difficulty throughout my secondary school days.

I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade 
eight.
When I met my new girlfriend with another man in the street.

When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his 
friends and that he was dead.
My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.

I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with 
whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
When I got a message that my child was not feeling well.

When I received the acceptance form for the second year at 
university.

I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to pose 
twelve times, over  a period of four weeks, before I could get a 
snap of mine.  Every time the film was processed my snap did not 
come out although the others did.

I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA 
demonstrations.

When I found my boyfriend, who I had been dating for a year, at 
another girl's house. We had had previous conflicts concerning 
the girl, but he had always claimed they were just friends.

The same as for SHAME and DISGUST. I was asked to resign my 
sorority which I did because I was ashamed.
Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.

I saw in a movie a block on which affluence and poverty existed. 
I saw that the rich made no attempts to help the poor.

When I felt powerless to help the poor or when I don't know how 
to.

I received a grade above average on a midterm (chemistry) and I 
expected onevery below average.

Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and 
she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry. 
She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the 
workshift to me so I did not sign up.

I did not do as well as I expected on a chemistry exam. I 
received a score below the average and I thought I had done very 
well.

Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he told 
me that although he told me he was going to take me to the 
concert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayed 
overnight and I said \well

One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of my 
close friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymore 
because he was jealous.

I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I 
realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never 
see eachother again and none of it mattered.
I felt extreme joy the day I was baptized. I was one with God.

I experienced anger most recently when I had committed a sin 
which I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made a 
vow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.

I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my 
long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.
Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left 
some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My 
uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that 
we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.

When I took the B.A exams,I was expecting a 1st class even though 
I had not done very well. When the results came out I felt sad as 
I had missed the 1st class by 12 marks.

When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on 
my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.
When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.
When my aunt died.

When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.  I was the first in 
the family to have got a 1st class, so all the family members 
were very happy and they gave me the opportunity to study 
further.

When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry. 
I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does  
badly at school, my family members blame me as well.

[ When family mmembers or friends blame me for something I am not 
responsible for.  I feel very sad as it was not my fault.]
When last year in college I received the award \Best Student of the Year\"

[ It irritates me when people talk about me behind my back.  I    
prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face instead 
of talking behind my back.]
[ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]

In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small 
picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and 
cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had 
for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

One night we, all the family members, were sitting in the front 
corridor of the house when a gentleman looking person came in.  
He was my father's client and he had come to bribe my father in 
connection with the proceeding case.  At my father's refusal he 
abused my father, my brother and I could not control our temper 
and we rushed at him.

Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very 
controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed 
with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So 
I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very 
sad about this.

I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my 
birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.

When a person whom I had invited did not come on the appointed 
day and time.

I tried my level best to care for my client, I took an 
appointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor he 
expired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.
When I got the scholarship letter from Australia.
[ When I do not get any co-operation from my friends/partners.]
When my brother's visa for the U.S.A got cancelled.

When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in 
the family after 19 years of baby boys.

When my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room after 
I had told her that I was  only in the bathroom having a shower. 
 She left and I had to do without supper.

When I received the news that my beloved grandmother had died.  I 
was at the boarding school and was only 13 years old.

I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a 
great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the 
large number of pupils who fail.
When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.

When a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could 
not make it to the second year.

After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5 
examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter of 
acceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia telling 
me that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.

A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad 
manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their 
telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.
When I got to know that my father had passed away.

When I received the first year results as the first year had 
involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the 
results.

When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I 
was stopped from punching him for it.

When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was 
the first time that I lost a brother.

The computer at school had left out my name along with four 
others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find 
my name on the medical schhol list.

I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving 
me any thing - money to come back to school.
